did.unittitle: Iron Workers Association of Reading, Pennsylvania, Records

repository.corpname: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries

did.abstract: Notebook with handwritten constitution and by-laws of association.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Copyright Information
userestrict.p: Permission to publish from these Papers must be obtained in writing from both the University of Connecticut Libraries and the owner(s) of the copyright.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: One notebook of Constitution and By-Laws of the Iron Workers Association of Reading, Pennsylvania. No dates can be found in the notebook but it is likely from the late 1800s.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of materials pertaining to business history in the United States, particularly Connecticut. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the Reading Room desk.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The history of this association may be tied to the unionization of ironworkers in the Reading, Pennsylvania, area in the late nineteenth century but no direct relationship has been determined.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item description, #:#], Iron Workers Association of Reading, Pennsylvania Records. Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center, University of Connecticut Libraries.
